history.content:
It's been pretty mathy so far. Here's hw1 for 189 this semester; see for yourself. https://d1b10bmlvqabco.cloudfront.net/attach/is83id8c49m5at/hktxrdcysf3325/ish3kqo2dllv/hw1.pdf

From another student:

Yes, it's significantly more mathy. There is overlap, but consider it the difference between algorithms in 61B and algorithms in 170. In 61B you learn about algorithms, how to use them, and some basic ways of thinking about them/proving some facts. In 170 you're asked to build up a top-down understanding. I think the analogy holds well for the different viewpoints on ML in 188/189.

Commenting on the first student's answer: if I recall correctly, the homeworks tended to alternate between more mathy and more coding-y assignments; while I agree that 189 is quite math-intensive, not all of the homeworks are like that one. Just many.

I would also agree with the comparison between 61B and 170, but I think I have a different definition of "top-down" than the above poster does (in that I appear to have the exact opposite definition): like 170, 189 is more concerned with the details of understanding the algorithms than 61B/188..

It's been pretty mathy so far. Here's hw1 for 189 this semester; see for yourself. https://d1b10bmlvqabco.cloudfront.net/attach/is83id8c49m5at/hktxrdcysf3325/ish3kqo2dllv/hw1.pdf

Yes, it's significantly more mathy. There is overlap, but consider it the difference between algorithms in 61B and algorithms in 170. In 61B you learn about algorithms, how to use them, and some basic ways of thinking about them/proving some facts. In 170 you're asked to build up a top-down understanding. I think the analogy holds well for the different viewpoints on ML in 188/189.

children.subject: (For me there wasn't much math at all in 189)
Definitely not the only homework with math... our hw2 looks super mathy too

But that's the only homework with any math in it though...

Took 189 last semester.

history.content:
Hey guys,

Is 189 significantly more difficult/higher workload than the last 1/2 of 188, all of which seemed to be an introduction to ML? Is there any overlap between 188 ML and 189? It felt like an okay difficulty to me by the end and I ended up with an A- in the class overall but I'm generally just awful at math. I've taken 53/54/70 etc. but I still hated those classes and as a result didn't do great in any of them. I'm much better at the CS/algorithms side.

What's the balance between math and CS in 189?
history.subject: 188 ML vs 189
